review: I ordered 2 of them.  The first one worked great, but the second would not boot.  Amazon immediately did the RMA thing and replaced it in 3 days, so no complaint there.  However, I'm a little nervous about Google's quality control.  When they work, they work great.  Great way to add Netflix to the kitchen TV.
author: Shawn

review: This is a handy device if you don't have a streaming device already. It's really simple. You pick what you want to watch on Netflix/ YouTube/ google play and direct it to play via the chromecast. I run it from my IPad and which I can turn off to conserve power with no hitch it stream. It's also really simple to set up as well. I only wish it was Amazon friendly.
author: Jowa

review: We thought it sounded like a good idea. We have a Netflix subscription and were able to hook it up and watch a couple of movies but we had a hard time adjusting the sound quality. During normal dialog, you could barely make out what they were saying, then an action scene would suddenly arise with music so loud you have to turn down the volume. We could never get adjusted. We were too frustrated to enjoy the movies. We don't have that problem watching TV movies normally. Also, we noticed on several occasions that the device had changed the settings on our TV, so we had to get out a different remote that came with the TV and re-adjust things back to the way we liked. I unplugged the device yesterday and filed it away under M for mistakes.
